name: taxingly

in a way that is difficult or that needs a lot of thought or effort: It was a taxingly long and slow process to collect all of the information and enter it into a single spreadsheet. Our trainer took us through a taxingly thorough workout session.
More examplesFewer examplesThe tuba is one of the more taxingly difficult instruments to play. The lift was broken, so it took a taxingly steep climb up four flights of stairs to get to the office.
